column4: hello, is it possible to upgrade from 4.10 to the current stable version?
ah, online update?
no need to download cd?
hmm
hehe
ah, i thought that old versions would become unsupported
they do eventually....but I think hoary has until 2006 at the earliest
would i upgrade through synaptic or apt?
or is there another means?
you would need to change your sources.list, then apt-get dist-upgrade, and that's that
ah
when breezy is released, there will be clear instructions on how to update on the web, telling you what to change
then onto hoary for now
I'm using it...it's good :)
lol
i'm happy with ubuntu too, no need to convince me :)
so dist-upgrade doesn't exist for now?
dist-upgrade exists, and you are free to use breezy, but it isn't recommended
hmm, but can't i get a dst-upgrade for hoary? i'm using an earlier version
*dist
oh, yeah...look on the wiki for warty->hoary instructions, and be prepared for some downloading
ah, ok. thanks :D that was all i wanted
http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/HoaryUpgradeNotes
